DataElement.preferredName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Trial Person Pregnancy Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of a person's condition or state of pregnancy at the time of participating in a research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes sponsored by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP) having a developing embryo or fetus in her body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Trial Person Pregnancy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person participating in a research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes sponsored by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP) having a developing embryo or fetus in her body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon

ObjectClass.preferredName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Trial Person
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The National Surgical adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP) is a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. . In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:Person; a human being.

Concepts.longName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project
Concepts.definition: A clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.

Property.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state of pregnancy at a particular time.
